p: In non-endemic regions, the number of hepatitis E cases in humans seems to be on the rise largely due to an increasing interest in this disease. Recent efforts have been done to evaluate the reliability of HEV diagnostic tools [ 10, 74]. One retrospective study has reported that the incidence of hepatitis E in France was stable over a period of 5Â years, suggesting that hepatitis E is generally under-diagnosed [ 80]. Clinicians need better awareness of this disease in order to accurately determine the incidence of HEV infection.
